contentful.shortDesc: Peer-manned helpline open 10am - 10pm daily for LGBTQ+ callers.
contentful.longDesc: At Switchboard we provide an information, support and referral service for lesbians, gay men and bisexual and trans people – and anyone considering issues around their sexuality and/or gender identity.
contentful.title: Switchboard

contentful.shortDesc: THINGS CAN GET TOUGH, BUT WE CAN HELP YOU GET YOUR LIFE BACK.
contentful.longDesc: Livechat and helpline open 5pm - midnight, 365 days a year.
contentful.title: CALM (Campaign Against Living Miserably)

contentful.shortDesc: We're here to listen
contentful.longDesc: A confidential, free phoneline for anyone in Scotland over the age of 16, feeling low, anxious or depressed. You can call them (6pm Friday - 6am Monday) or (6pm to 2am on weekdays.)
contentful.title: Breathing Space

contentful.shortDesc: If you need someone to talk to, we listen. We won't judge or tell you what to do.
contentful.longDesc: To talk about anything that is upsetting you, you can contact Samaritans 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. You can call 116 123 (free from any phone).
contentful.title: Samaritans

contentful.shortDesc: PAPYRUS is the national charity dedicated to the prevention of young suicide.
contentful.longDesc: Confidential suicide prevention advice for young people open 9am - midnight 365 days of the year.
contentful.title: Papyrus (Prevention of Young Suicide)

contentful.shortDesc: 24/7 helpline offering a supportive listening service to anyone with thoughts of suicide.
contentful.longDesc: 24/7 helpline offering a supportive listening service to anyone with thoughts of suicide.
contentful.title: National Suicide Prevention Hotline UK

contentful.shortDesc: Our team is online to offer you free, confidential advice with drugs or alcohol.
contentful.longDesc: Confidential online chat online Monday - Friday 9am to 9pm, Saturday - Sunday 10am to 4pm. You can still message the service outside of these hours, they will get back to you as soon as possible.
contentful.title: We Are With You

contentful.shortDesc: Here for you 24/7
contentful.longDesc: A free, confidential, anonymous text support service. You can text 'SHOUT' to 852258 from wherever you are in the UK.
contentful.title: SHOUT

contentful.shortDesc: Lifelink can offer support to anyone who is struggling to cope with everyday stress or is feeling anxious or depressed.
contentful.longDesc: Two hour long wellbeing classes delivered virtually. Each session covers life skills aimed at helping yoiu to lead a fulfilling and productive life. Participants can attend as many classes as they link and these are open to everyone with a Glasgow postcode.
contentful.title: LifeLink

contentful.shortDesc: Our mission is to make the world healthier and happier through the super power of calm.
contentful.longDesc: A series of ten minute meditations for you to practice.
contentful.title: Calm

contentful.shortDesc: Wellbeing services south Glasgow
contentful.longDesc: A variety of self-help materials and courses based on Cognitive Behavioural Therapy (CBT) to help with all sorts of problems that you may be facing.
contentful.title: Wellbeing

contentful.shortDesc: We're Mind, the mental health charity. We’re fighting for better mental health – for support, for respect, for you.
contentful.longDesc: A series of videos educating and sharing tips to look after your mental health and wellbeing.
contentful.title: Mind

contentful.shortDesc: Smiling Mind
contentful.longDesc: Smiling Mind is a unique tool developed by psychologists and educators to help bring balance to your life. Practice ten minutes of mindfulness every day.
contentful.title: Smiling Mind

contentful.shortDesc: Bearable - Symptoms & Mood tracker
contentful.longDesc: Mood and symptom tracker and health diary with stats. Empowers people to reclaim control over their well-being by making mood and symptom tracking simple, convenient, and accessible to all.
contentful.title: Bearable

contentful.shortDesc: The Feeling Good app is accredited by NHS digital - a mark of its effectiveness, safety and good function.
contentful.longDesc: Relax your body and mind with a series of audio tracks designed to help you build confidence, energy and a positive mindset.
contentful.title: Feeling Good

contentful.shortDesc: Catch It is a joint project between the Universities of Liverpool and Manchester, to help users better understand their moods through use of an ongoing diary.
contentful.longDesc: Learn how to manage feelings like anxiety and depression with Catch It. The app will teach you how to look at problems in a different way, turn negative thoughts into positive ones and improve your mental wellbeing.
contentful.title: Catch It

contentful.shortDesc: Hub of Hope believes that no matter what you're going through, you shouldn't have to do it alone. Find services local to you using geolocation technology.
contentful.longDesc: UK’s leading mental health support database. It is provided by national mental health charity, Chasing the Stigma, and brings local, national, peer, community, charity, private and NHS mental health support and services together in one place for the first time.
contentful.title: Hub of Hope

contentful.shortDesc: Atmosphere: Relaxing Sounds - Rain & Sleep sounds
contentful.longDesc: Atmosphere is the perfect app to relax. Enjoy a variety of relaxing sounds divided into different environments.
contentful.title: Atmosphere

contentful.shortDesc: Aura: Meditations, Sleep & Mindfulness
contentful.longDesc: Aura helps you transform your wellbeing & sleep with the world's most personalised, all-in-one app for mental wellness.
contentful.title: Aura

contentful.shortDesc: Concerned about self-harming? Feeling suicidal? Not sure what to do next? Then this app is for you.
contentful.longDesc: The distrACT app gives you easy, quick and discreet access to information and advice about self-harm and suicidal thoughts. The content has been created by doctors and experts in self-harming and suicide prevention.
contentful.title: distrACT

contentful.shortDesc: Find information and support for your mental health.
contentful.longDesc: Find information and support for your mental health.
contentful.title: NHS Mental Health

contentful.shortDesc: Reflectly: Diary, Gratitude Journal & Mood Tracker
contentful.longDesc: The number one journalling app that’s like your best friend. Vent your thoughts & feelings to track your mood & increase happiness. Get daily insights & explore how you feel with your own digital diary.
contentful.title: Reflectly

contentful.shortDesc: Calm Harm - manages self harm
contentful.longDesc: Calm Harm is an app designed to help people resist or manage the urge to self-harm. It's private and password protected.
contentful.title: Calm Harm

contentful.shortDesc: Routes of Use: Boofing
contentful.longDesc: This presentation, brought to you by MaineGeneral’s Community Health Department, covers boofing (sometimes called “plugging” or “booty bumping”). The health educator will teach you about how a high works when a substance is boofed, list some commonly boofed substances,
contentful.title: Booty bumping

contentful.shortDesc: Injection Technique: Veins vs. Arteries
contentful.longDesc: This presentation, brought to you by MaineGeneral’s Community Health Department, covers veins and arteries in the context of substance use. The health risks associated with hitting an artery (instead of a vein) when mainlining (injecting intravenously) are discussed, and methods of prevention and self-care are provided.
contentful.title: Injection technique: veins vs. arteries

contentful.shortDesc: Injection Related Injuries: Vein Collapse
contentful.longDesc: This presentation covers vein collapse, a potentially dangerous injury which can result from injection drug use. The causes and health risks associated with vein collapse are discussed and methods of prevention are provided. Brought to you by MaineGeneral’s Community Health Department.
contentful.title: Injection related injuries: vein collapse

contentful.shortDesc: MAT Standards implementation explained.
contentful.longDesc:
How the rapid implementation of the new standards can help save lives.
Everyone who needs treatment should expect the same response wherever they are in Scotland. 
Working to ensure access to the right treatment, when it’s needed, and where its needed, marks a step-change in tackling drug-related deaths.
contentful.title: MAT Standards Implementation

contentful.shortDesc: Meeting the Benzodiazepines Challenge
contentful.longDesc: Benzodiazepines and unregulated ‘Street’ Benzo’s are costing lives in Scotland.  What can we do to address this and tackle the rising danger of poly-drug use?
contentful.title: Addressing the rise of benzodiazepines

contentful.shortDesc: What are MAT Standards; Why do they matter?
contentful.longDesc: How establishing best practice in Medication Assisted treatment, and making it widely available across Scotland, can reduce the risk of fatal overdose.
contentful.title: What are MAT standards?

contentful.shortDesc: Honest information about drugs
contentful.longDesc: If you or someone else needs urgent help after taking drugs or drinking, call 999 for an ambulance. Tell the crew everything you know. It could save their life.
contentful.title: Talk to Frank

contentful.shortDesc: People come to AA through many different means... choose the path that best suits you. If you prefer e-mail as a means of contact then feel free to email us at help@aamail.org
contentful.longDesc: Help and support for anyone experiencing problems with alcohol use.
contentful.title: Alcoholics Anonymous

contentful.shortDesc: We are here to support you if you are concerned about someone else’s alcohol or drug use. We can chat, offer advice and information, and link you either into our own services or services local to you.
contentful.longDesc: If you are concerned about someone else's alcohol or drug use, contact our Helpline today. Open 9am-11pm weekdays and a call-back service on weekends. Also available by email helpline@sfad.org.uk and webchat.
contentful.title: Scottish Families Affected by Alcohol and Drugs

contentful.shortDesc: Help and Advice
contentful.longDesc: Release provides a free confidential and non-judgemental national information and advice service in relation to drugs and drug laws.
contentful.title: Release

contentful.shortDesc: How to make a great foil pipe (with 45 degree angle tip)
contentful.longDesc: Exchange Supplies sell packs of foil sheets as a 'reverse transition intervention' to enable drug services to encourage people to move away from injecting routes of drug administration.
contentful.title: How to make a foil pipe

contentful.shortDesc: Experience, Strength and Hope
contentful.longDesc: Peer-manned helpline available 8am - 11pm 7 days a week who can assist you in finding a meeting or just talk with you.
contentful.title: Cocaine Anonymous Helpline

contentful.shortDesc: Connects people who use drugs with community members when they are vulnerable to overdose.
contentful.longDesc: Connects people who use drugs with community members when they are vulnerable to overdose.
contentful.title: Brave

contentful.shortDesc: Pill reports, drug profiles & safer use advice.
contentful.longDesc: Pill reports, drug profiles & safer use advice.
contentful.title: KnowDrugs

contentful.shortDesc: Free, confidential helpline and live chat option for those seeking help with alcohol use.
contentful.longDesc: Free, confidential helpline and live chat option for those seeking help with alcohol use.
contentful.title: Alcoholics Anonymous Helpline

contentful.shortDesc: Our team is online to offer you free, confidential advice with drugs or alcohol.
contentful.longDesc: Confidential online chat online Monday - Friday 9am to 9pm, Saturday - Sunday 10am to 4pm. You can still message the service outside of these hours, they will get back to you as soon as possible.
contentful.title: We Are With You

contentful.shortDesc: Routes of use: Ingestion
contentful.longDesc: This presentation, brought to you by MaineGeneral’s Community Health Department, covers ingestion (swallowing). The health educator will teach you about how a high works when a substance is ingested, list some commonly ingested substances, discuss some of the risks associated with ingestion, and provide you with harm reduction techniques.
contentful.title: Ingestion

contentful.shortDesc: We offer Alcohol Counselling, Group work and deliver Alcohol Brief Interventions in Glasgow and surrounding areas. We offer introductory to advanced level Training Courses.
contentful.longDesc: A voluntary organisation working with individuals, families and communities to promote health and wellbeing. GCA offer direct support for people to abstain from alcohol or reduce their alcohol consumption, provide training and education and work in partnership with communities and other agencies to achieve our main aim of reducing the harm caused by alcohol and drugs.
contentful.title: Glasgow Council on Alcohol

contentful.shortDesc: Find out about the different kinds of support we offer and what to expect when you come into one of our services
contentful.longDesc: Free and confidential services for individuals, families and communities affected by drugs and alcohol.
contentful.title: North West/North East Glasgow Recovery Hub

contentful.shortDesc: AlcoDroid is an alcohol consumption tracker, drinks diary and blood alcohol content calculator.
contentful.longDesc: AlcoDroid is an alcohol consumption tracker, drinks diary and blood alcohol content calculator.
contentful.title: Alcodroid

contentful.shortDesc: Together We Recover
contentful.longDesc: A peer led voluntary organisation that provides a variety of recovery initiatives within North East Glasgow.
contentful.title: North East Recovery Community

contentful.shortDesc: South Glasgow Alcohol & Drug Recovery Hub
contentful.longDesc: Offers a friendly, flexible support service to individuals experiencing problematic alcohol or substance use.
contentful.title: South Community Recovery Hub

contentful.shortDesc: Cocaine Anonymous is a fellowship of men and women who share their experience, strength and hope with each other, so that they may solve their common problem and help others to recover from their addiction.
contentful.longDesc: Help and support for anyone who wants to stop using cocaine.
contentful.title: Cocaine Anonymous

contentful.shortDesc: Routes of Use: Smoking
contentful.longDesc: This presentation, brought to you by MaineGeneral’s Community Health Department, covers smoking. The health educator will teach you about how a high works when a substance is smoked, list some commonly smoked substances, discuss some of the risks associated with smoking, and provide you with harm reduction techniques.
contentful.title: Smoking

contentful.shortDesc: How to avoid a stimulant overdose
contentful.longDesc:
To mark international Overdose Day, Youth RISE has produced this educational video covering:
What can cause a stimulant overdose?
How do you spot a stimulant overdose?
Tips to avoid a stimulant overdose
contentful.title: How to avoid a stimulant overdose

contentful.shortDesc: We are Narcotics Anonymous in the United Kingdom & Channel Islands. If you have a problem with drugs, we are recovering drug addicts who can help you get and stay clean.
contentful.longDesc: Support for anyone who wants to stop using drugs.
contentful.title: Narcotics Anonymous

contentful.shortDesc: Animation of naloxone
contentful.longDesc: Video © Copyrights SDF. 2020.
contentful.title: Naloxone

contentful.shortDesc: A mobile application designed to reduce the harms associated with the use of psychoactive substances. Provides reliable and honest information about drugs.
contentful.longDesc: A mobile application designed to reduce the harms associated with the use of psychoactive substances. Provides reliable and honest information about drugs.
contentful.title: TrippApp

contentful.shortDesc: How much citric? - the citric / heroin reaction
contentful.longDesc: A short film explaining the reaction that takes place when an acid is added to water in order to dissolve brown heroin. Essential viewing for everyone who injects heroin, and those who work with them. Now with subtitles, so you can watch it on silent.
contentful.title: How much Citric? The Citric/Heroin Reaction

contentful.shortDesc: Track and moderate your use of alcohol, caffeine and other recreational drugs.
contentful.longDesc: Track and moderate your use of alcohol, caffeine and other recreational drugs.
contentful.title: Dose - Drug Journal

contentful.shortDesc: How to Inject Into a Vein
contentful.longDesc: Injecting medication into a vein can be difficult and should not be attempted without professional guidance. When injecting into a vein, you may need to increase access to the vein by making it more visible. Use sterile equipment and inject the medication with the flow of blood.
contentful.title: Injecting into a Vein

contentful.shortDesc: Oor Willie's Peer Support Life / Recovery Group & wave 70/30 Edinburgh Hub
contentful.longDesc: Peer support and addiction based support group for all to come together and offer support. Willie does a live chat every Wednesday and Saturday at 8pm guaranteed, with other sessions randomly throughout the week for you to come along and be a part of a community.
contentful.title: Oor Willie's peer support

contentful.shortDesc: Safer Injecting: Vein Care Tips for People Who Use Injection Drugs
contentful.longDesc: This 5-part video series presents vein care tips for people who use injection drugs. Using a harm reduction approach, we talk about the planning, supplies, setup, and aftercare for safer injecting.
contentful.title: Vein Care Tips for People who Inject Drugs

contentful.shortDesc: Advice on harm reduction, safer drug use, naloxone, recognising/responding to overdose.
contentful.longDesc: Advice on harm reduction, safer drug use, naloxone, recognising/responding to overdose.
contentful.title: Highland Overdose Prevention and Engagement

contentful.shortDesc: Connecting Communities in Recovery
contentful.longDesc: North West Recovery Communities is a community led partnership of people and services who are passionate about promoting recovery from Alcohol and Drugs. The partnership promotes that “Recovery is Possible” through a range of activities.
contentful.title: North West Recovery Community

contentful.shortDesc: Injection Technique: Step-by-Step Guide to Mainlining
contentful.longDesc: This presentation, brought to you by MaineGeneral’s Community Health Department, provides a step-by-step walk-through of a mainline (intravenous) injection. Hygiene, materials, substance prep, site prep, injection form, and aftercare are all discussed, and a medical-grade prosthetic arm is used for demonstration.
contentful.title: Injection Technique: Mainlining

contentful.shortDesc: Recovery (the recovery position)
contentful.longDesc: Unique short film showing how to put someone who is unconscious and breathing in the recovery position.
contentful.title: The recovery position

contentful.shortDesc: Injection Technique: Skin Popping
contentful.longDesc: This presentation, brought to you by MaineGeneral’s Community Health Department, covers skin popping, which is when you consume substances by injecting subcutaneously (into your skin). The health risks associated with skin popping are discussed, and techniques are provided.
contentful.title: Injection Technique: Skin Popping

contentful.shortDesc: This video features animations depicting injecting, please be mindful of any effect this may have on your wellbeing.
contentful.longDesc: Injecting anything comes with a risk, here are 5 things to know that can reduce that risk. If you want to know more about safer injecting or have questions about drug use in general visit www.touchbase.org.au Australia’s National LGBTI focused Drug, Alcohol and Mental Health resource.
contentful.title: 5 Things to know about safer injecting

contentful.shortDesc: Cleaning works: how to clean a used syringe
contentful.longDesc: A simple 'one water, one bleach, one water' cleaning technique based on the science explained in the youtube 'does cleaning syringes work?' and 'hep C survival in syringes'.

image.imageTitle: Cat 2 - How to clean a syringe

contentful.title: Cleaning works: how to clean a syringe

contentful.shortDesc: Jane from Exchange Supplies introduces the range of needles that are available, and explains the benefits of using the shortest, thinnest needle to reach the vein.
contentful.longDesc:
Jane from Exchange Supplies introduces the range of needles that are available, and explains the benefits of using the shortest, thinnest needle to reach the vein.

Click next to find out more about more about how the gauge numbering system works to make choosing the best needle easier.
contentful.title: Woman to Woman: Needle sizes explaine

contentful.shortDesc: Woman to Woman: Injecting in the groin
contentful.longDesc:
The video interview with Jane from Exchange Supplies on the next page has been made for women who inject drugs and are currently (or are thinking about) injecting into their femoral vein (going 'in the groin').

In the film she passes on her experience as someone who last injected into the femoral vein more than 10 years ago, and still has significant and painful leg problems as a result.

Viewer discretion is advised.
contentful.title: Woman to Woman: Injecting in the groin

contentful.shortDesc: Harm reduction works
contentful.longDesc: This website supports the harm reduction works campaign materials. The campaign was developed by Exchange Supplies for the National Treatment Agency as part of the implementation of the Department of Health publication Reducing Drug Related Harm: An Action Plan. The plan commits to reducing the burden of illness and death caused by illicit drug use through improved surveillance of service provision, improved delivery of harm reduction services, and information campaigns aimed at drug users and drug service providers.
contentful.title: General Harm Reduction information.

contentful.shortDesc: Needle and Syringe Programme Practitioner Training
contentful.longDesc:
NICE guidance PH52 on the provision of needle and syringe exchange sets out 3 levels of service.

Our certificated training will build to give the workforce free online access to the skills and knowledge needed to deliver effective needle exchange services at all levels.
contentful.title: Online resources and e-learning training for drug use.

contentful.shortDesc: BUILDING POWER AND EQUITY WITH PEOPLE WHO USE DRUGS through access, advocacy and action
contentful.longDesc: National Harm Reduction Coalition creates spaces for dialogue and action that help heal the harms caused by racialized drug policies.
contentful.title: Resources that promote the health and dignity of people affected by drug use.

contentful.shortDesc: JUST SAY KNOW - Crew is a harm reduction and outreach charity based in Scotland
contentful.longDesc: We neither condemn nor condone drug use: we exist to reduce harm, challenge perceptions and help people make positive choices about their use of cannabis, stimulant and other social drugs and sexual health by providing non-judgemental, credible and up to date information and support.
contentful.title: Drugs Information from Crew 2000
